text:
Miss Susan looked at her pityingly and said, "I am too ill."

"You are wrong, my lord."

passages.fragment: Miss Susan looked at her pityingly and said , ``
passages.full_quote: <used>Miss Susan looked at her pityingly and said, "Y</used>ou never know what's going to happen in thirty seconds?"

The sight of this officer recalled Villefort from the third heaven to earth; he composed his face, as we have before described, <used>and said, "I h</used>ave read the letter, sir, and you have acted rightly in arresting this man; now inform me what you have discovered concerning him and the conspiracy."
he <used>said, "I am</used> very straightforward in my dealings-take your choice."

passages.fragment: , `` I am too ill. '' `` You are wrong ,
passages.full_quote: "No," replied Madame Dangl<used>ars, "I am too ill." "You are wrong," r</used>eplied Villefort, significantly; "it is important that you should be seen there."
